contentHtml:
BEIJING, Oct.18 (Xinhua) -- China plans to establish a quality-oriented evaluation system to improve operation and customs clearance efficiency for China-Europe freight trains, according to Ning Jizhe, Deputy Director of the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC).

It is noted that China-Europe freight trains are expected to improve quality in areas such as optimizing development layout, fixing targeted positioning, adhering to market operation and improving business environment, enhancing communications and cooperation, as well as innovating service modes, according to Ning. (Edited by Jiang Feifan, Niu Huizhe)
title: China to establish new evaluation system for China-Europe freight trains
description: China plans to establish a quality-oriented evaluation system to improve operation and customs clearance efficiency for China-Europe freight trains, according to Ning Jizhe, Deputy Director of the National Development and Reform Commission.

author: 许凤,赵晓辉,华晔迪
contentHtml:
Central SOEs deliver strong performance in H1

 

  BEIJING, July 28 (Xinhua) -- Centrally-administered state-owned enterprises (SOEs) performed well in the first half of the year, with better performance expected in the second half, regulators said on Tuesday.

  These SOEs have seen a steady rise of profitability, especially in the second quarter of the year, the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission (SASAC) of the State Council said.

  In the first six months, they garnered an operating revenue of 11 trillion yuan (1.8 trillion U.S. dollars) and reaped 643 billion yuan of profits.

  There are around 110 SOEs under the administration of SASAC, which include such giants as China National Petroleum Corp. (CNPC), Sinopec Group and China Mobile.

  Around 91 percent of these SOEs were profitable in the first half of 2015, SASAC said, citing lower cost and better operations.

  With China's pro-growth policies expected to take effect and the companies' efforts to lower cost and improve efficiency, SASAC said these SOEs are generally optimistic about the second half.  Enditem
title: Central SOEs deliver strong performance in H1
